   19: %%
   20: -module(shell_docs_markdown_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% callbacks
   23: -export([all/0, groups/0, init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   24: 
   25: %% test format
   26: -export([convert_erlang_html/1, convert_unknown_format/1]).
   27: 
   28: %% test non-existing moduledoc
   29: -export([non_existing_moduledoc/1,hidden_moduledoc/1,existing_moduledoc/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% test non-existing docs
   32: -export([non_existing_doc/1, hidden_doc/1, existing_doc/1]).
   33: 
   34: %% headings
   35: -export([h1_test/1, h2_test/1, h3_test/1, h4_test/1, h5_test/1, h6_test/1,
   36:          setext_h1/1, setext_h2/1]).
   37: 
   38: %% quotes
   39: -export([single_line_quote_test/1, double_char_for_quote_test/1,
   40:          ignore_three_spaces_before_quote/1, multiple_line_quote_test/1,
   41:          paragraph_in_between_test/1, quote_with_anchor_test/1, quote_without_space/1]).
   42: 
   43: %% paragraph
   44: -export([paragraph_after_heading_test/1, quote_before_and_after_paragraph_test/1]).
   45: 
   46: %% inline code
   47: -export([single_line_code_test/1, multiple_line_code_test/1, paragraph_between_code_test/1]).
   48: 
   49: %% fence code
   50: -export([single_line_fence_code_test/1, multiple_line_fence_code_test/1,
   51:          paragraph_between_fence_code_test/1, fence_code_ignores_link_format_test/1,
   52:          fence_code_with_spaces/1]).
   53: 
   54: %% br
   55: -export([start_with_br_test/1, multiple_br_followed_by_paragraph_test/1,
   56:          multiple_lines_of_a_paragraph_test/1, ending_br_test/1]).
   57: 
   58: %% Comments
   59: -export([begin_comment_test/1, after_paragraph_comment/1, forget_closing_comment/1 ]).
   60: 
   61: %% Format
   62: -export([format_heading_test/1, format_paragraph_test/1, format_multiple_inline/1,
   63:          format_multiple_inline_format_short/1, format_multiple_inline_format_long/1,
   64:          format_multiple_inline_format_mixed/1, unmatched_format_simple/1,
   65:          unmatched_format_with_inline/1, unmatched_complex_format_with_inline/1,
   66:          format_inline_link_with_inline/1, complex_inline_format/1, skip_symbols_in_inline/1,
   67:          format_header_identifier/1, italic_in_middle_word_test/1, italic_with_colons/1,
   68:          list_format_with_italics_in_sentence/1, list_format_with_bold_in_sentence/1,
   69:          new_lines_test/1, format_separator_test/1, list_with_format/1, multi_word_format_test/1,
   70:          multiline_link/1, multiline_link_not_allowed/1, inline_mfa_link/1,
   71:          escaped_character/1]).
   72: 
   73: %% Bullet lists
   74: -export([singleton_bullet_list/1, singleton_bullet_list_followed_new_paragraph/1, singleton_bullet_list_with_format/1,
   75:          singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph/1, singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph2/1,
   76:          singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph3/1, multiline_bullet_indented_list/1, multiline_bullet_indented_list2/1,
   77:          multiline_bullet_list/1, even_nested_bullet_list/1, odd_nested_bullet_list/1,
   78:          complex_nested_bullet_list/1, complex_nested_bullet_list2/1, complex_nested_bullet_list3/1,
   79:          bullet_list_mix_with_number_list/1, inline_code_list/1, bullet_list_with_anchor/1]).
   80: 
   81: %% Numbered lists
   82: -export([singleton_numbered_list/1, singleton_numbered_list_followed_new_paragraph/1,
   83:          singleton_numbered_list_with_format/1, singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph/1,
   84:          singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph2/1, multiline_numbered_indented_list/1,
   85:          multiline_numbered_indented_list2/1, multiline_numbered_list/1, even_nested_numbered_list/1,
   86:          odd_nested_numbered_list/1]).
   87: 
   88: -export([table_with_rows/1, table_with_escaped_bars/1, fake_table_test/1]).
   89: 
   90: -define(ERLANG_HTML, ~"application/erlang+html").
   91: 
   92: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   93: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   94: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   95: 
   96: 
   97: -define(EXPECTED_FUN(Expected), {{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Expected, #{}}).
   98: 
   99: all() ->
  100:     [{group, different_format_generator},
  101:      {group, module_generator},
  102:      {group, doc_generator},
  103:      {group, header_generator},
  104:      {group, quote_generator},
  105:      {group, paragraph_generator},
  106:      {group, code_generator},
  107:      {group, fence_code_generator},
  108:      {group, br_generator},
  109:      {group, comment_generator},
  110:      {group, format_generator},
  111:      {group, bullet_list_generator},
  112:      {group, numbered_list_generator},
  113:      {group, table_generator}
  114:     ].
  115: 
  116: groups() ->
  117:     [{different_format_generator, [sequence], different_format_conversion_tests()},
  118:      {module_generator, [sequence], moduledoc_tests()},
  119:      {doc_generator, [sequence], doc_tests()},
  120:      {header_generator, [sequence], header_tests()},
  121:      {quote_generator, [sequence], quote_tests()},
  122:      {paragraph_generator, [sequence], paragraph_tests()},
  123:      {code_generator, [sequence], code_tests()},
  124:      {fence_code_generator, [sequence], fence_code_tests()},
  125:      {br_generator, [sequence], br_tests()},
  126:      {comment_generator, [sequence], comment_tests()},
  127:      {format_generator, [sequence], format_tests()},
  128:      {bullet_list_generator, [sequence], bullet_list_tests()},
  129:      {numbered_list_generator, [sequence], numbered_list_tests()},
  130:      {table_generator, [sequence], table_tests()}
  131:     ].
  132: 
  133: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  134:     Config.
  135: 
  136: end_per_group(_, _Config) ->
  137:     ok.
  138: 
  139: different_format_conversion_tests() ->
  140:     [ convert_erlang_html,
  141:       convert_unknown_format
  142:     ].
  143: 
  144: moduledoc_tests() ->
  145:     [ non_existing_moduledoc,
  146:       hidden_moduledoc,
  147:       existing_moduledoc
  148:     ].
  149: 
  150: doc_tests() ->
  151:     [ non_existing_doc,
  152:       hidden_doc,
  153:       existing_doc
  154:     ].
  155: 
  156: header_tests() ->
  157:     [ h1_test,
  158:       h2_test,
  159:       h3_test,
  160:       h4_test,
  161:       h5_test,
  162:       h6_test,
  163:       setext_h1,
  164:       setext_h2
  165:     ].
  166: 
  167: quote_tests() ->
  168:     [ single_line_quote_test,
  169:       double_char_for_quote_test,
  170:       ignore_three_spaces_before_quote,
  171:       multiple_line_quote_test,
  172:       paragraph_in_between_test,
  173:       quote_with_anchor_test,
  174:       quote_without_space
  175:     ].
  176: 
  177: paragraph_tests() ->
  178:     [ paragraph_after_heading_test,
  179:       quote_before_and_after_paragraph_test
  180:     ].
  181: 
  182: code_tests() ->
  183:     [ single_line_code_test,
  184:       multiple_line_code_test,
  185:       paragraph_between_code_test
  186:     ].
  187: 
  188: fence_code_tests() ->
  189:   [single_line_fence_code_test,
  190:    multiple_line_fence_code_test,
  191:    paragraph_between_fence_code_test,
  192:    fence_code_ignores_link_format_test,
  193:    fence_code_with_spaces
  194:   ].
  195: 
  196: br_tests() ->
  197:     [ start_with_br_test,
  198:       multiple_br_followed_by_paragraph_test,
  199:       multiple_lines_of_a_paragraph_test,
  200:       ending_br_test
  201:     ].
  202: 
  203: comment_tests() ->
  204:     [ begin_comment_test,
  205:       after_paragraph_comment,
  206:       forget_closing_comment
  207:     ].
  208: 
  209: format_tests() ->
  210:     [ format_heading_test,
  211:       format_paragraph_test,
  212:       format_multiple_inline,
  213:       format_multiple_inline_format_long,
  214:       format_multiple_inline_format_short,
  215:       format_multiple_inline_format_mixed,
  216:       unmatched_format_simple,
  217:       unmatched_format_with_inline,
  218:       unmatched_complex_format_with_inline,
  219:       format_inline_link_with_inline,
  220:       complex_inline_format,
  221:       skip_symbols_in_inline,
  222:       format_header_identifier,
  223:       italic_in_middle_word_test,
  224:       italic_with_colons,
  225:       list_format_with_italics_in_sentence,
  226:       list_format_with_bold_in_sentence,
  227:       new_lines_test,
  228:       format_separator_test,
  229:       list_with_format,
  230:       multi_word_format_test,
  231:       multiline_link,
  232:       multiline_link_not_allowed,
  233:       inline_mfa_link,
  234:       escaped_character
  235:     ].
  236: 
  237: bullet_list_tests() ->
  238:     [ singleton_bullet_list,
  239:       singleton_bullet_list_followed_new_paragraph,
  240:       singleton_bullet_list_with_format,
  241:       singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph,
  242:       singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph2,
  243:       singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph3,
  244:       multiline_bullet_indented_list,
  245:       multiline_bullet_indented_list2,
  246:       multiline_bullet_list,
  247:       even_nested_bullet_list,
  248:       odd_nested_bullet_list,
  249:       complex_nested_bullet_list,
  250:       complex_nested_bullet_list2,
  251:       complex_nested_bullet_list3,
  252:       bullet_list_mix_with_number_list,
  253:       inline_code_list,
  254:       bullet_list_with_anchor
  255:     ].
  256: 
  257: numbered_list_tests() ->
  258:     [ singleton_numbered_list,
  259:       singleton_numbered_list_followed_new_paragraph,
  260:       singleton_numbered_list_with_format,
  261:       singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph,
  262:       singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph2,
  263:       multiline_numbered_indented_list,
  264:       multiline_numbered_indented_list2,
  265:       multiline_numbered_list,
  266:       even_nested_numbered_list,
  267:       odd_nested_numbered_list
  268:     ].
  269: 
  270: table_tests() ->
  271:   [ table_with_rows,
  272:     table_with_escaped_bars,
  273:     fake_table_test].
  274: 
  275: convert_erlang_html(_Conf) ->
  276:     Doc = #{~"en" => [{p, [], [~"Test"]}]},
  277:     Functions = [{{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Doc, #{}}],
  278: 
  279:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ?ERLANG_HTML, none, #{}, Functions),
  280:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: convert_unknown_format(_Conf) ->
  284:     Doc = #{~"en" => ~"<text>Here</text>"},
  285:     Functions = create_fun(Doc),
  286: 
  287:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"xml", Doc, #{},Functions),
  288:     ok = try
  289:            shell_docs:validate(Docs)
  290:          catch
  291:            error:function_clause ->
  292:              ok
  293:          end,
  294:     ok.
  295: 
  296: non_existing_moduledoc(_Conf) ->
  297:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", none, #{}, []),
  298:     _ = compile(Docs),
  299:     ok.
  300: 
  301: hidden_moduledoc(_Conf) ->
  302:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", hidden, #{}, []),
  303:     _ = compile(Docs),
  304:     ok.
  305: 
  306: existing_moduledoc(_Conf) ->
  307:     Docs = create_eep48_doc(~"# Here"),
  308:     HtmlDocs = compile(Docs),
  309:     #{~"en" := HtmlModDoc} = extract_moduledoc(HtmlDocs),
  310:     H1 = header(1, ~"Here"),
  311:     [H1] = HtmlModDoc,
  312:     ok.
  313: 
  314: non_existing_doc(_Conf) ->
  315:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", none, #{}, create_fun(none)),
  316:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
  317:     ok.
  318: 
  319: hidden_doc(_Conf) ->
  320:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", none, #{}, create_fun(hidden)),
  321:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
  322:     ok.
  323: 
  324: existing_doc(_Conf) ->
  325:     Docs = create_eep48_doc(~"Test"),
  326:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
  327:     ok.
  328: 
  329: h1_test(_Conf) ->
  330:     Input = ~"# Here",
  331:     Result = [header(1, ~"Here")],
  332:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  333: 
  334: h2_test(_Conf) ->
  335:     Input = ~"# Here\n## Header 2",
  336:     Result = [header(1, ~"Here"), header(2,~"Header 2")],
  337:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  338: 
  339: h3_test(_Conf) ->
  340:     Input = ~"# Here\n### Header 3",
  341:     Result = [header(1, ~"Here"), header(3, ~"Header 3")],
  342:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  343: 
  344: h4_test(_Conf) ->
  345:     Input = ~"### Here\n#### Header 4",
  346:     Result = [header(3, ~"Here"), header(4, ~"Header 4")],
  347:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  348: 
  349: h5_test(_Conf) ->
  350:     Convert = fun shell_docs_markdown:parse_md/1,
  351:     Doc = #{~"en" => Convert(~"### Here\n#### Header 4\n##### H5")},
  352:     DocH5 = #{~"en" => Convert(~"##### H5")},
  353:     Functions = [{{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Doc, #{}},
  354:                  {{function, bar, 0}, [], [], DocH5, #{}}],
  355:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", Doc, #{}, Functions),
  356: 
  357:     HtmlDocs = compile(Docs),
  358:     ExpectedH3 = #{~"en" => [ header(3, ~"Here"),
  359:                               header(4, ~"Header 4"),
  360:                               header(5, ~"H5")]},
  361:     ExpectedH5 = #{~"en" => [ header(5, ~"H5") ]},
  362:     ExpectedH3 = extract_moduledoc(HtmlDocs),
  363:     [ E1, E2 ] = extract_doc(HtmlDocs),
  364:     {{function, foo, 0}, [], [], ExpectedH3, #{}} = E1,
  365:     {{function, bar, 0}, [], [], ExpectedH5, #{}} = E2,
  366:     ok.
  367: 
  368: h6_test(_Conf) ->
  369:     Convert = fun shell_docs_markdown:parse_md/1,
  370:     Doc = #{~"en" => Convert(~"### Here\n#### Header 4\n##### H5")},
  371:     DocH6 = #{~"en" => Convert(~"###### H6\n## H2")},
  372:     Functions = [{{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Doc, #{}},
  373:                  {{function, bar, 0}, [], [], DocH6, #{}}],
  374:     Docs = create_eep48(erlang, ~"application/erlang+html", Doc, #{}, Functions),
  375: 
  376:     HtmlDocs = compile(Docs),
  377:     ExpectedH3 = #{~"en" => [ header(3, ~"Here"),
  378:                               header(4, ~"Header 4"),
  379:                               header(5, ~"H5")]},
  380:     ExpectedH6 = #{~"en" => [ header(6, ~"H6"),
  381:                               header(2, ~"H2")]},
  382:     ExpectedH3 = extract_moduledoc(HtmlDocs),
  383:     [ E1, E2 ] = extract_doc(HtmlDocs),
  384:     {{function, foo, 0}, [], [], ExpectedH3, #{}} = E1,
  385:     {{function, bar, 0}, [], [], ExpectedH6, #{}} = E2,
  386:     ok.
  387: 
  388: setext_h1(_Config) ->
  389:     Input = ~"Here\n===\n\nNew text",
  390:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Here"),
  391:                p(~"New text")],
  392:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  393: 
  394: setext_h2(_Config) ->
  395:     Input = ~"Here\n--\n\nNew text",
  396:     Result = [ header(2, ~"Here"),
  397:                p(~"New text")],
  398:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  399: 
  400: single_line_quote_test(_Conf) ->
  401:     Input = ~"# Here\n> This is a quote",
  402:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Here"),
  403:                blockquote(p(~"This is a quote"))],
  404:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  405: 
  406: double_char_for_quote_test(_Conf) ->
  407:     Input = ~"# Here\n>> This is a quote",
  408:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Here"),
  409:                blockquote(p(~"This is a quote"))],
  410:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  411: 
  412: ignore_three_spaces_before_quote(_Conf) ->
  413:     Input = ~"   > # Here",
  414:     Result = blockquote([header(1, ~"Here")]),
  415:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  416: 
  417: multiple_line_quote_test(_Conf) ->
  418:     Input = ~"> # Here\n> This is a quote",
  419:     Result = [ blockquote([header(1, ~"Here"),
  420:                            p(~"This is a quote")])],
  421:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  422: 
  423: paragraph_in_between_test(_Conf) ->
  424:     Input = ~"# Header 1\nThis is text\n> A quote\n> continues\n## Header 2\nBody content",
  425:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Header 1"),
  426:                p(~"This is text"),
  427:                blockquote([p(~"A quote continues")]),
  428:                header(2, ~"Header 2"),
  429:                p(~"Body content")],
  430:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  431: 
  432: quote_with_anchor_test(_Config) ->
  433:     Input =
  434: ~"> #### Note{: .info }
  435: >
  436: > The [User's Guide](index.html) has examples and a
  437: > [Getting Started](using_ssh.md) section.",
  438:     Result = [blockquote([header(4,~"Note"),
  439:                                      p([~"The User's Guide has examples and a Getting Started section."])])],
  440:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  441: 
  442: quote_without_space(_Config) ->
  443:     Input =
  444: ~"> #### Note{: .info }
  445: >
  446: >The [User's Guide](index.html) has examples and a
  447: > [Getting Started](using_ssh.md) section.",
  448:     Result = [blockquote([header(4,~"Note"),
  449:                                      p([~"The User's Guide has examples and a Getting Started section."])])],
  450:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  451: 
  452: paragraph_after_heading_test(_Conf) ->
  453:     Input = ~"# Header 1\nThis is text\n\nBody content",
  454:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Header 1"),
  455:                p(~"This is text"),
  456:                p(~"Body content")],
  457:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  458: 
  459: quote_before_and_after_paragraph_test(_Conf) ->
  460:     Input = ~"> Quote 1\nThis is text\n> Quote 2\nBody content",
  461:     Result = [ blockquote(p(~"Quote 1")),
  462:                p(~"This is text"),
  463:                blockquote(p(~"Quote 2")),
  464:                p(~"Body content")],
  465:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  466: 
  467: single_line_code_test(_Conf) ->
  468:     Input = ~"# Here\n    This is code",
  469:     Result = [ header(1, ~"Here"),
  470:                code(~"This is code\n")],
  471:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  472: 
  473: multiple_line_code_test(_Conf) ->
  474:     Input = ~"    # Here\n    This is code\n        Nested Line",
  475:     Result = code(~"# Here\nThis is code\n    Nested Line\n"),
  476:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  477: 
  478: paragraph_between_code_test(_Conf) ->
  479:     Input = <<"This is a paragraph\n",
  480:               "\n",
  481:               "    # Here\n",
  482:               "    This is code\n",
  483:               "        Nested Line\n",
  484:               "Another paragraph">>,
  485:     Result = [ p(~"This is a paragraph"),
  486:                code(~"# Here\nThis is code\n    Nested Line\n"),
  487:                p(~"Another paragraph")],
  488:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  489: 
  490: single_line_fence_code_test(_Conf) ->
  491:     Input = ~"
  492: ```erlang
  493: test() -> ok.
  494: ```",
  495:     Result = [ code(~"test() -> ok.\n")],
  496:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  497: 
  498: multiple_line_fence_code_test(_Conf) ->
  499:     Input = ~"
  500: ```erlang
  501: test() ->
  502:   ok.
  503: ```",
  504:     Result = [ code(~"test() ->\n  ok.\n")],
  505:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  506: 
  507: 
  508: paragraph_between_fence_code_test(_Conf) ->
  509:     Input = ~"This is a test:
  510: ```erlang
  511: test() ->
  512:   ok.
  513: ```",
  514:     Result = [p(~"This is a test:"),
  515:                          code(~"test() ->\n  ok.\n")],
  516:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  517: 
  518: fence_code_ignores_link_format_test(_Conf) ->
  519:     Input = ~"This is a test:
  520: ```erlang
  521: [foo](bar)
  522: ```",
  523:     Result = [p(~"This is a test:"),
  524:               code(~"[foo](bar)\n")],
  525:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  526: 
  527: fence_code_with_spaces(_Config) ->
  528:     Input =
  529: ~"  ```erlang
  530:   [foo](bar)
  531: ```",
  532:     Result = [code(~"  [foo](bar)\n")],
  533:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  534: 
  535: start_with_br_test(_Conf) ->
  536:     Input = ~"\n\nAnother paragraph",
  537:     Result = [ p(~"Another paragraph")],
  538:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  539: 
  540: multiple_br_followed_by_paragraph_test(_Conf) ->
  541:     Input = ~"\nAnother paragraph\n\nAnother paragraph",
  542:     Result = [ p(~"Another paragraph"),
  543:                p(~"Another paragraph")],
  544:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  545: 
  546: multiple_lines_of_a_paragraph_test(_Conf) ->
  547:   Input = ~"""
  548: Returns a new list `List3`, which is made from the elements of `List1` followed
  549: by the elements of `List2`.
  550: """,
  551:     Result = [p([~"Returns a new list ",
  552:                  inline_code(~"List3"),
  553:                  ~", which is made from the elements of ",
  554:                  inline_code(~"List1"), ~" followed by the elements of ",
  555:                  inline_code(~"List2"), ~"."])],
  556:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  557: 
  558: ending_br_test(_Conf) ->
  559:     Input = ~"Test\n",
  560:     Result = [ p(~"Test")],
  561:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  562: 
  563: begin_comment_test(_Conf) ->
  564:     Input = ~"<!-- Ignore -->Test",
  565:     Result = [ p(~"Test")],
  566:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  567: 
  568: after_paragraph_comment(_Conf) ->
  569:     Input = ~"Test\n<!-- Ignore -->Test",
  570:     Result = [ p(~"Test"), p(~"Test")],
  571:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  572: 
  573: forget_closing_comment(_Conf) ->
  574:     ok = try
  575:            create_eep48_doc(~"Test\n<!-- Ignore Test")
  576:          catch
  577:            error:missing_close_comment ->
  578:              ok
  579:          end,
  580:     ok.
  581: 
  582: format_heading_test(_Conf) ->
  583:     Input = ~"# **H1**\n## _H2_\n### `H3`",
  584:     Result = [ header(1, em(~"H1")),
  585:                header(2, it(~"H2")),
  586:                header(3, inline_code(~"H3"))
  587:              ],
  588:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  589: 
  590: format_paragraph_test(_Conf) ->
  591:     Input = ~"**H1** *HH* _H2_ __H3__ `code`",
  592:     Result = [ p([ em(~"H1"),
  593:                    ~" ",
  594:                    it(~"HH"),
  595:                    ~" ",
  596:                    it(~"H2"),
  597:                    ~" ",
  598:                    em(~"H3"),
  599:                    ~" ",
  600:                    inline_code(~"code")
  601:                  ])
  602:              ],
  603:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  604: 
  605: format_multiple_inline(_Conf) ->
  606:     Input = ~"**H1 *HH***",
  607:     Result = [ p([ em([~"H1 ", it(~"HH")])]) ],
  608:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  609: 
  610: format_multiple_inline_format_long(_Conf) ->
  611:     Input = ~"**H1 __HH__**",
  612:     Result = [ p([ em([~"H1 ", em(~"HH")])]) ],
  613:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  614: 
  615: format_multiple_inline_format_short(_Conf) ->
  616:     Input = ~"_H1 *HH*_",
  617:     Result = [ p([ it([~"H1 ", it(~"HH")])])],
  618:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  619: 
  620: format_multiple_inline_format_mixed(_Conf) ->
  621:     Input = ~"__H1 *HH* _test_ **test2**__ _there_",
  622:     Result = [ p([ em([~"H1 ", it(~"HH"), ~" ", it(~"test"), ~" ", em(~"test2")]),
  623:                    ~" ",
  624:                    it(~"there")])
  625:              ],
  626:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  627: 
  628: unmatched_format_simple(_Conf) ->
  629:     Input = ~"**Bold*",
  630:     Result = [ p([~"**Bold*" ])],
  631:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  632: 
  633: unmatched_format_with_inline(_Conf) ->
  634:     Input = ~"**Bold *Italics*",
  635:     Result = p([~"**Bold ", it(~"Italics") ]),
  636:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  637: 
  638: unmatched_complex_format_with_inline(_Conf) ->
  639:     Input = ~"__H1 *HH* _test_ **test2** _there_ ",
  640:     Result = [ p([ ~"__H1 ", it(~"HH"), ~" ", it(~"test"), ~" ",
  641:                    em(~"test2"),
  642:                    ~" ",
  643:                    it(~"there"), ~" "])
  644:              ],
  645:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  646: 
  647: format_inline_link_with_inline(_Config) ->
  648:     Input = ~"[`splitwith/2`](`splitwith/2`) behaves as if",
  649:     Result = [ p([inline_code(~"splitwith/2"),~" behaves as if"])],
  650:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  651: 
  652: complex_inline_format(_Config) ->
  653:   %% The complexity here comes from the _, where the alg needs to backtrack
  654:   %% add the _ to an existing buffer, and continue where it left off using  %% any previous opening format characters, in this case **.
  655:   Input = ~"**`{set_alarm, {AlarmId, AlarmDescr}}`**",
  656:   Result = p(em(inline_code(~"{set_alarm, {AlarmId, AlarmDescr}}"))),
  657:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  658: 
  659: italic_in_middle_word_test(_Config) ->
  660:   Input = ~"this ssh_daemon_channel is not in italics",
  661:   Result = p(~"this ssh_daemon_channel is not in italics"),
  662:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  663: 
  664: italic_with_colons(_Config) ->
  665:   Input = ~"_This is ok:_ **test:**",
  666:   Result = p([it(~"This is ok:"), ~" ", em(~"test:")]),
  667:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  668: 
  669: list_format_with_italics_in_sentence(_Config) ->
  670:   Input = ~"- Mandatory: one or more _Host key(s)_. Default is `/etc/ssh`",
  671:   Result = ul([li(p([~"Mandatory: one or more ",
  672:                      it(~"Host key(s)"),
  673:                      ~". Default is ",
  674:                      inline_code(~"/etc/ssh")]))]),
  675:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  676: 
  677: list_format_with_bold_in_sentence(_Config) ->
  678:   Input = ~"- Mandatory: one or more __Host key(s)__. Default is `/etc/ssh`",
  679:   Result = ul([li(p([~"Mandatory: one or more ",
  680:                      em(~"Host key(s)"),
  681:                      ~". Default is ",
  682:                      inline_code(~"/etc/ssh")]))]),
  683:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  684: 
  685: format_separator_test(_Config) ->
  686:   Input = ~"**This is a Test,**, including _a parens)_ and **This is a Test**, end",
  687:   Result = p([em(~"This is a Test,"),
  688:               ~", including ",
  689:               it(~"a parens)"),
  690:               ~" and ",
  691:               em(~"This is a Test"),
  692:               ~", end"
  693:              ]),
  694:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  695: 
  696: multi_word_format_test(_Config) ->
  697:   Input = ~"**`--help` (or `-h`)** - Print this message and exit.",
  698:   Result = p([em([inline_code(~"--help"),
  699:                   ~" (or ",
  700:                   inline_code(~"-h"),
  701:                   ~")"]),
  702:               ~" - Print this message and exit."]),
  703:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  704: 
  705: 
  706: multiline_link(_Config) ->
  707:   Input = ~"this is a [link with\nnew line](erlang.com)",
  708:   Result = p([~"this is a link with new line"]),
  709:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  710: 
  711: %% As per commonmark.js-0.28.1, Github Flavoured Markdown 0.23.10
  712: multiline_link_not_allowed(_Config) ->
  713:   Input = ~"this is a [link with new line]\n(erlang.com)",
  714:   Result = p([~"this is a [link with new line] (erlang.com)"]),
  715:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  716: 
  717: inline_mfa_link(_Config) ->
  718:   Input = ~"See `t:count()`, and `c:arith:plus/1`, `e:math:sum/2`, and `m:extra:here/1`",
  719:   Result = p([~"See ", inline_code(~"count()"), ~", and ",
  720:               inline_code(~"arith:plus/1"), ~", ",
  721:               inline_code(~"math:sum/2"), ~", and ",
  722:               inline_code(~"extra:here/1")]),
  723:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  724: 
  725: escaped_character(_Config) ->
  726:   Input = ~B"Here \*not bold\* and \`not code\` and \_means_nothing_ `\`test\``",
  727:   Result = p([~"Here *not bold* and `not code` and _means_nothing_ ",
  728:               inline_code(~"`test`")]),
  729:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  730: 
  731: list_with_format(_Config) ->
  732:   Input = ~"- **`--help` (or `-h`)** - Print this message and exit.",
  733:   Result = ul([li(p([em([inline_code(~"--help"),
  734:                          ~" (or ",
  735:                          inline_code(~"-h"),
  736:                          ~")"]),
  737:                      ~" - Print this message and exit."]))]),
  738:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  739: 
  740: new_lines_test(_Config) ->
  741:   Input = ~"Render in
  742: the same line",
  743:   Result = p([~"Render in the same line"]),
  744:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  745: 
  746: skip_symbols_in_inline(_Config) ->
  747:   Input = ~"**`{the_beginning, the_end}`**",
  748:   Result = p(em(inline_code(~"{the_beginning, the_end}"))),
  749:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  750: 
  751: format_header_identifier(_Config) ->
  752:   Input = ~"## Test {: #id .class} there",
  753:   Result = header(2, ~"Test  there"),
  754:   compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  755: 
  756: singleton_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  757:     Input = ~"* One liner",
  758:     Result = [ul([li(p(~"One liner"))])],
  759:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  760: 
  761: singleton_bullet_list_followed_new_paragraph(_Config) ->
  762:     Input = ~"* One liner\n\nThis is a new paragraph",
  763:     Result = [ul([li(p(~"One liner"))]), p(~"This is a new paragraph")],
  764:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  765: 
  766: singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph(_Config) ->
  767:     Input = ~"* One liner\n  This is a new paragraph",
  768:     Result = [ul([li([p([~"One liner This is a new paragraph"])])])],
  769:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  770: 
  771: singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph2(_Config) ->
  772:     Input = ~"* One liner.\nThis is a new paragraph",
  773:     Result = [ul([li([p([~"One liner. This is a new paragraph"])])])],
  774:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  775: 
  776: singleton_bullet_list_followed_inner_paragraph3(_Config) ->
  777:     Input = ~"* One liner\n\n  This is a new paragraph\n  continue here\n\n  and this one follows\n\nNew text",
  778:     Result = [ul([li([p(~"One liner"),
  779:                       p([~"This is a new paragraph continue here"]),
  780:                       p(~"and this one follows")])]),
  781:               p(~"New text")],
  782:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  783: 
  784: singleton_bullet_list_with_format(_Config) ->
  785:     Input = ~"* *One* __liner__",
  786:     Result = [ul([li(p([it(~"One"), ~" ",  em(~"liner")]))])],
  787:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  788: 
  789: multiline_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  790:     Input = ~"* One liner\n* Second line",
  791:     Result = [ul([li(p(~"One liner")), li(p(~"Second line"))])],
  792:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  793: 
  794: multiline_bullet_indented_list(_Config) ->
  795:     Input = ~"  * One liner\n  * Second line",
  796:     Result = [ul([li(p(~"One liner")), li(p(~"Second line"))])],
  797:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  798: 
  799: multiline_bullet_indented_list2(_Config) ->
  800:     Input = ~"  * _One liner_\n  * _Second_ `line`",
  801:     Result = [ul([li(p(it(~"One liner"))),
  802:                   li(p([it(~"Second"), ~" ",  inline_code(~"line")]))])],
  803:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  804: 
  805: even_nested_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  806:     Input = ~"* One liner\n  * First nested line\n  * Second nested line",
  807:     Result = [ul([
  808:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  809:                        ul([ li(p(~"First nested line")),
  810:                             li(p(~"Second nested line"))
  811:                           ])
  812:                      ])
  813:                  ])],
  814:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  815: 
  816: odd_nested_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  817:     Input = ~"* One liner\n  * First nested line\n  * Second nested line\n  * Third nested line",
  818:     Result = [ul([
  819:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  820:                        ul([ li(p(~"First nested line")),
  821:                             li(p(~"Second nested line")),
  822:                             li(p(~"Third nested line"))
  823:                           ])
  824:                      ])
  825:                  ])],
  826:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  827: 
  828: complex_nested_bullet_list(_Config) ->
  829:     Input = ~"* One liner\n  * First nested line\n* Second line",
  830:     Result = [ul([
  831:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  832:                        ul([ li(p(~"First nested line")) ])
  833:                      ]),
  834:                   li([p(~"Second line")])
  835:                  ])],
  836:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  837: 
  838: complex_nested_bullet_list2(_Config) ->
  839:     Input = ~"
  840: * One liner
  841:   * First nested line
  842:     * Second level nested line
  843:   * Second nested line
  844:     * Another nested line
  845: * Second one liner",
  846:     Result = [ul([
  847:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  848:                        ul([ li([
  849:                                 p(~"First nested line"),
  850:                                 ul([ li([p(~"Second level nested line")])])
  851:                                ]),
  852:                             li([
  853:                                 p(~"Second nested line"),
  854:                                 ul([ li([p(~"Another nested line")])])
  855:                                ])
  856:                           ])
  857:                      ]),
  858:                   li([ p(~"Second one liner")])
  859:                  ])],
  860:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  861: 
  862: complex_nested_bullet_list3(_Config) ->
  863:     Input = ~"
  864: - Optional: one or more _User's private key(s)_ in case of `publickey`
  865:   authorization. The default files are
  866:   - `id_dsa` and `id_dsa.pub`
  867:   - `id_rsa` and `id_rsa.pub`
  868:   - `id_ecdsa` and `id_ecdsa.pub`
  869: ",
  870:     Result = [ul([ li([p([~"Optional: one or more ",
  871:                           it(~"User's private key(s)"),
  872:                           ~" in case of ",
  873:                           inline_code(~"publickey"),
  874:                            ~" authorization. The default files are"]),
  875:                       ul([ li( [p([inline_code(~"id_dsa"),
  876:                                 ~" and ",
  877:                                 inline_code(~"id_dsa.pub")])]),
  878:                            li( [p([inline_code(~"id_rsa"),
  879:                                   ~" and ",
  880:                                   inline_code(~"id_rsa.pub")])]),
  881:                            li( [p([inline_code(~"id_ecdsa"),
  882:                                 ~" and ",
  883:                                inline_code(~"id_ecdsa.pub")])])])])])],
  884:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  885: 
  886: bullet_list_mix_with_number_list(_Config) ->
  887:     Input = ~"* Bullet list\n1. Numbered list",
  888:     Result = [ul([li([ p(~"Bullet list")])]),
  889:               ol([li([ p(~"Numbered list")])])],
  890:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  891: 
  892: inline_code_list(_Config) ->
  893:     Input = ~"""
  894: * ```
  895:   Code block
  896:     More code
  897:   ```
  898:   {: .class }
  899: """,
  900:     Result = [ul([li([ code(~"Code block\n  More code\n")])])],
  901:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  902: 
  903: %% this example could render the last line within the inner ul.
  904: %% the end result looks exactly the same, and the fix is non-trivial.
  905: bullet_list_with_anchor(_Config) ->
  906:     Input = ~"""
  907: - **`+c true | false`**{: #+c } - Enables or disables
  908:   [time correction](time_correction.md#time-correction):
  909: 
  910:   - **`true`** - Enables time correction.
  911:   - another example
  912: 
  913:   - **`false`** - Disables time correction.
  914: """,
  915:     Result = [ul([li([ p([em(inline_code(~"+c true | false")),
  916:                           ~" - Enables or disables time correction:"]),
  917:                        ul([li([ p([ em(inline_code(~"true")), ~" - Enables time correction."])]),
  918:                            li([ p(~"another example")])]),
  919:                        ul([li(p([ em(inline_code(~"false")), ~" - Disables time correction."]))])])])],
  920:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  921: 
  922: singleton_numbered_list(_Config) ->
  923:     Input = ~"1. One liner",
  924:     Result = [ol([li(p(~"One liner"))])],
  925:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  926: 
  927: singleton_numbered_list_followed_new_paragraph(_Config) ->
  928:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n\nThis is a new paragraph",
  929:     Result = [ol([li(p(~"One liner"))]), p(~"This is a new paragraph")],
  930:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  931: 
  932: singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph(_Config) ->
  933:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n  This is a new paragraph",
  934:     Result = [ol([li([p([~"One liner This is a new paragraph"])])])],
  935:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  936: 
  937: singleton_numbered_list_followed_inner_paragraph2(_Config) ->
  938:     Input = ~"1. One liner.\nThis is a new paragraph",
  939:     Result = [ol([li([p([~"One liner. This is a new paragraph"])])])],
  940:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  941: 
  942: singleton_numbered_list_with_format(_Config) ->
  943:     Input = ~"1. *One* __liner__",
  944:     Result = [ol([li(p([it(~"One"), ~" ",  em(~"liner")]))])],
  945:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  946: 
  947: multiline_numbered_indented_list(_Config) ->
  948:     Input = ~"  1. One liner\n  2. Second line",
  949:     Result = [ol([li(p(~"One liner")), li(p(~"Second line"))])],
  950:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  951: 
  952: multiline_numbered_indented_list2(_Config) ->
  953:     Input = ~"  1. _One liner_\n  2. _Second_ `line`",
  954:     Result = [ol([li(p(it(~"One liner"))),
  955:                   li(p([it(~"Second"), ~" ",  inline_code(~"line")]))])],
  956:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  957: 
  958: multiline_numbered_list(_Config) ->
  959:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n2. Second line",
  960:     Result = [ol([li(p(~"One liner")), li(p(~"Second line"))])],
  961:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  962: 
  963: even_nested_numbered_list(_Config) ->
  964:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n  1. First nested line\n  2. Second nested line",
  965:     Result = [ol([
  966:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  967:                        ol([ li(p(~"First nested line")),
  968:                             li(p(~"Second nested line"))
  969:                           ])
  970:                      ])
  971:                  ])],
  972:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  973: 
  974: odd_nested_numbered_list(_Config) ->
  975:     Input = ~"1. One liner\n  1. First nested line\n  2. Second nested line\n  3. Third nested line",
  976:     Result = [ol([
  977:                   li([ p(~"One liner"),
  978:                        ol([ li(p(~"First nested line")),
  979:                             li(p(~"Second nested line")),
  980:                             li(p(~"Third nested line"))
  981:                           ])
  982:                      ])
  983:                  ])],
  984:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  985: 
  986: 
  987: table_with_rows(_Config) ->
  988:     Input = ~"""
  989: | H1 | H2 | H3 |
  990: |:-----|:--:|----|
  991: |D1   | D2 | D3 |
  992: """,
  993:     Result = table([~"| H1 | H2 | H3 |\n",
  994:                                 ~"|:-----|:--:|----|\n",
  995:                                 ~"|D1   | D2 | D3 |\n"]),
  996:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
  997: 
  998: table_with_escaped_bars(_Config) ->
  999:     Input = ~"""
 1000: | **JSON** | **Erlang**             |
 1001: |----------|------------------------|
 1002: | Number   | `integer() \| float()` |
 1003: """,
 1004:     Result = table([~"| **JSON** | **Erlang**             |\n",
 1005:                     ~"|----------|------------------------|\n",
 1006:                     ~"| Number   | `integer() \\| float()` |\n"]),
 1007:     compile_and_compare(Input, Result).
 1008: 
 1009: fake_table_test(_Config) ->
 1010:     NotTable = ~"""
 1011: | **JSON** | **Erlang**
 1012: """,
 1013:     Result = [p([~"| ", em(~"JSON"), ~" | ", em(~"Erlang")])],
 1014:     compile_and_compare(NotTable, Result).
 1015: 
 1016: header(Level, Text) when is_integer(Level) ->
 1017:     HeadingLevel = integer_to_list(Level),
 1018:     HeadingLevelAtom = list_to_existing_atom("h" ++ HeadingLevel),
 1019:     {HeadingLevelAtom, [], [Text]}.
 1020: 
 1021: code(X) ->
 1022:     {pre,[],[inline_code(X)]}.
 1023: 
 1024: table(Table) when is_list(Table) ->
 1025:     {pre,[], [inline_code(Table)]}.
 1026: 
 1027: inline_code(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1028:     {code,[],X};
 1029: inline_code(X) ->
 1030:     {code,[],[X]}.
 1031: 
 1032: p(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1033:     {p, [], X};
 1034: p(X) when is_tuple(X); is_binary(X) ->
 1035:     p([X]).
 1036: 
 1037: blockquote(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1038:   {blockquote, [], X};
 1039: blockquote(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
 1040:     {blockquote, [], [Tuple]}.
 1041: 
 1042: em(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1043:     {em, [], X};
 1044: em(X) when is_binary(X); is_tuple(X) ->
 1045:     em([X]).
 1046: 
 1047: it(X) when is_list(X) ->
 1048:     {i, [], X};
 1049: it(X) when is_binary(X); is_tuple(X) ->
 1050:     it([X]).
 1051: 
 1052: ul(Items) when is_list(Items) ->
 1053:     {ul, [], Items}.
 1054: 
 1055: ol(Items) when is_list(Items) ->
 1056:     {ol, [], Items}.
 1057: 
 1058: li(Item) when is_tuple(Item); is_binary(Item) ->
 1059:     li([Item]);
 1060: li(Items) when is_list(Items) ->
 1061:     {li, [], Items}.
 1062: 
 1063: -spec create_eep48(Language, Mime, ModuleDoc, Metadata, Docs) -> #docs_v1{} when
 1064:       Language  :: atom(),
 1065:       Mime      :: binary(),
 1066:       ModuleDoc :: #{DocLanguage := DocValue} | none | hidden,
 1067:       Metadata  :: map(),
 1068:       Docs      :: [{{Kind, Name, Arity},
 1069:                      Anno :: erl_anno:anno(),
 1070:                      Signature :: [binary()],
 1071:                      Doc :: #{DocLanguage := DocValue} | none | hidden,
 1072:                      Metadata :: map()
 1073:                     }],
 1074:       Kind      :: function | type | callback,
 1075:       Name      :: atom(),
 1076:       Arity     :: non_neg_integer(),
 1077:       DocLanguage :: binary(),
 1078:       DocValue :: binary() | term().
 1079: create_eep48(Language, Mime, ModuleDoc, Metadata, Docs) ->
 1080:     #docs_v1{anno = [],
 1081:              beam_language = Language,
 1082:              format = Mime,
 1083:              module_doc = ModuleDoc,
 1084:              metadata = maps:merge(#{ otp_doc_vsn => ?CURR_DOC_VERSION }, Metadata),
 1085:              docs = Docs}.
 1086: 
 1087: extract_moduledoc(Docs) ->
 1088:     Docs#docs_v1.module_doc.
 1089: 
 1090: extract_doc(Docs) ->
 1091:     Docs#docs_v1.docs.
 1092: 
 1093: extract_format(Docs) ->
 1094:     Docs#docs_v1.format.
 1095: 
 1096: create_eep48_doc(Doc) when is_binary(Doc) ->
 1097:     create_eep48_doc(Doc, ~"application/erlang+html").
 1098: 
 1099: create_eep48_doc(Doc, Format) when is_binary(Doc) ->
 1100:     Docs = #{~"en" => shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(Doc)},
 1101:     create_eep48(erlang, Format, Docs, #{}, create_fun(Docs)).
 1102: 
 1103: create_fun(Docs) ->
 1104:     [{{function, foo, 0}, [], [], Docs, #{}}].
 1105: 
 1106: expected(X) when is_list(X)->
 1107:     #{~"en" => X};
 1108: expected(X) when is_tuple(X) ->
 1109:     expected([X]).
 1110: 
 1111: compile(Docs) ->
 1112:     ok = shell_docs:validate(Docs),
 1113:     ?NATIVE_FORMAT = extract_format(Docs),
 1114:     Docs.
 1115: 
 1116: compile_and_compare(Input, Result) ->
 1117:     Docs = create_eep48_doc(Input),
 1118:     HtmlDocs = compile(Docs),
 1119: 
 1120:     Expected = expected(Result),
 1121:     Expected = extract_moduledoc(HtmlDocs),
 1122:     [ ?EXPECTED_FUN(Expected) ] = extract_doc(HtmlDocs),
 1123:     ok.
